title: Substitution
text: To eliminate all $$y$$ terms from the second equation, substitute the first equation expressing $$y$$ only in terms of $$x$$ into the second equation.

title: Substituted Expression
text: What is the resulting expression in terms of only $$x$$ after simplifying?

title: Solve for $$x$$
text: To solve for the value(s) of $$x$$, isolate the variable from the equation. Note the positive and negative answers that result from taking a square root.

title: Solve for $$y$$
text: To solve for the two values of $$y$$, substitute each of the $$x$$ values into the first equation of $$y=-x$$. The value of $$x$$ and $$y$$ should be equal with opposite signs.
